days.summary: Cloudy or partly cloudy with showers. Gale or severe gales at height.

high.Gales: Gale force winds (gusts over 50mph) make walking difficult and strenuous with a potential to be blown over by gusts. There is often a marked increase in winds through cols or on exposed ridges and summits. Distances can take longer to cover and compass bearings become harder to follow accurately.
high.Severe Chill Effect: Wind significantly lowers the ‘feels-like’ temperature relative to the actual temperature, with even moderate winds significantly adding to the chilling effect. Strong winds can result in a severe and debilitating wind chill many degrees below the actual temperature. This effect will be enhanced in rain or wet snow. Without protection, prolonged exposure could result in frost nip or frostbite on exposed parts of the body and/or hypothermia.

medium.Poor Visibility: Poor visibility presents challenging route finding conditions. Visibility could be significantly less than 50 metres in all directions with few or no visual references, especially on featureless moors or plateaux. Distances become hard to judge and cliff or cornice edges can be difficult to recognise. These conditions require good navigational skills. There is a risk of white-out conditions when mist or fog is combined with extensive snow cover.

days.summary: Cloudy or partly cloudy overnight with occasional showers, these wintry over the summits. Rather cloudy during daylight hours with bright spells and wintry showers. The showers often of snow above 700m, but rain or sleet lower down. The wintry showers becoming well scattered in the evening with clear spells. Chilly with summit gales and severe wind chill.
days.visibility: Occasional or extensive cloud, base around the summits, but lowering to around 600m in showers. Visibility very good or excellent, but moderate to very poor in cloud and showers.
days.ground_conditions: No recent ground conditions report available.
days.weather: Bright spells. Chilly with summit gales and snow showers.

days.summary: Partly cloudy overnight with scattered or isolated wintry showers. Bright spells and occasional wintry showers during daylight hours, then mainly dry with clearing skies in the evening. Showers mainly wintry above 700m with rain lower down.
days.max_wind: West 20 to 25mph gusting 35mph with significant wind chill.

temperature.Freezing level: 800m rising to around the highest summits during daylight hours.

days.visibility: Occasional or extensive cloud, base around the summits, but lowering to around 600m at times in showers. Visibility very good or excellent, but moderate to very poor in summit cloud and showers.

days.summary: Mainly dry with bright, sunny or clear spells. Frost early and later. Chance of freezing fog in the valleys. Light winds at height. Freezing most levels rising to around 600m around midday.

Mainly dry with bright, sunny or clear spells. Frost early and later. Chance of freezing fog in the valleys. Moderate to fresh southeasterly winds at height. Freezing most levels rising to around 600m around midday.
Mainly dry with bright or clear spells. Frost possible early. Freezing level mainly near or above the summits. Fresh to strong south or southeast winds at height.
